etymologies: late 19th century: probably from gelatin + Latin (l)ignis ‘wood’+ -ite

definitions: a high explosive made from a gel of nitroglycerine and nitrocellulose in a base of wood pulp and sodium or potassium nitrate, used particularly for rock blasting.
shortDefinitions: high explosive made from gel of nitroglycerine and nitrocellulose in base of wood pulp and sodium or potassium nitrate
